PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Should this be stated in terms of `D : I ⥤ C` instead?

Good question. This actually applies to all four variants. They all could be stated so that the LHS "always applies" or that the RHS "always applies". Since the two existing variants are stated so that the RHS always applies, I did the same for the new variants. In your application, you need the RHS version, but in my application I actually need the LHS version. Of course, `D.unop.op` is definitionally equal to `D`, but relying on things like this is how you get goals that can only be solved by `erw`, so l guess I'll add four more variants. The hardest part will be the naming...
I have added the variants.

```suggestion
section ProCoyonedaContravariantLeftOp
```

```suggestion
haveI : HasColimit (D.leftOp.rightOp ⋙ coyoneda) :=
    inferInstanceAs <| HasColimit (D ⋙ coyoneda)
  apply colimitCoyonedaHomIsoLimit_π_apply
```
and similarly below.

If you add a
```
local instance : HasColimit (D.leftOp.rightOp ⋙ coyoneda) :=
  inferInstanceAs <| HasColimit (D ⋙ coyoneda)
```
this can become
```suggestion
  colimitCoyonedaHomIsoLimit D.leftOp F
```
Since you will never want to unfold these `colimitCoyonedaHomIsoLimit`s, I think it's fine to just rely on the defeq here.

I have applied this change, but I chose to inline the instances into the terms instead of adding a `local instance`. This way, it is clear that the local instance is not required in the statement of the definition/theorems, which is important to make sure that users can use these results without having to restate the local instances.

```suggestion
    limit.π (D.leftOp ⋙ F ⋙ uliftFunctor.{u₁}) (op i) ((colimitCoyonedaHomIsoLimitLeftOp D F).hom f) =
      ⟨f.app (D.obj i).unop ((colimit.ι (D ⋙ coyoneda) i).app (D.obj i).unop
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(CategoryTheory): dualize `IndYoneda`
